metadata.description: Comprehensive aviation claims dataset for BS detector evaluation

claims.claim: The Wright brothers' first powered flight was in 1903
claims.explanation: Well-documented historical fact - December 17, 1903

claims.claim: Commercial airplanes can fly backwards
claims.explanation: Aircraft are not designed for reverse flight

claims.claim: The Boeing 747 has four engines
claims.explanation: Standard configuration for Boeing 747

claims.claim: Helicopters use jet engines to create lift with their rotors
claims.explanation: Helicopters use rotor blades for lift, not jet thrust

claims.claim: The Concorde could fly at Mach 2.04
claims.explanation: Concorde's cruise speed was Mach 2.04 (1,354 mph)

claims.claim: The Airbus A380 can carry over 850 passengers
claims.explanation: In all-economy configuration, A380 can carry 853 passengers

claims.claim: Modern commercial jets fly at altitudes above 60,000 feet
claims.explanation: Commercial jets typically cruise at 35,000-42,000 feet

claims.claim: The SR-71 Blackbird could fly at Mach 3.3
claims.explanation: SR-71's top speed was Mach 3.3 (2,193 mph)

claims.claim: All modern fighter jets have stealth technology
claims.explanation: Only specific models like F-22, F-35, B-2 have true stealth

claims.claim: The Boeing 737 MAX is the safest aircraft ever built
claims.explanation: 737 MAX had significant safety issues leading to groundings

claims.claim: Turbulence has never caused a commercial plane crash in modern aviation
claims.explanation: While injuries occur, turbulence alone hasn't caused modern crashes

claims.claim: The Antonov An-225 was the largest aircraft ever built
claims.explanation: By maximum takeoff weight and cargo volume, An-225 was largest

claims.claim: Electric aircraft will replace all jet aircraft by 2030
claims.explanation: Battery technology limitations make this timeline unrealistic

claims.claim: The F-22 Raptor can supercruise at Mach 1.8
claims.explanation: F-22 can sustain Mach 1.5-1.8 without afterburners

claims.claim: The Airbus A380 program was cancelled due to lack of orders
claims.explanation: Technically true but oversimplifies complex market factors

claims.claim: Pilots don't actually fly planes anymore, computers do everything
claims.explanation: While automation exists, pilots remain essential for safety

claims.claim: Flying is statistically safer than driving
claims.explanation: Per mile traveled, commercial aviation is much safer

claims.claim: Some military aircraft can fly in space
claims.explanation: No aircraft can fly in space; spacecraft are different

claims.claim: The Boeing 797 will revolutionize air travel
claims.explanation: Boeing 797 doesn't exist yet, still in concept phase

claims.claim: Supersonic passenger travel will return by 2025
claims.explanation: While companies are working on it, 2025 is too optimistic

claims.claim: Jet engines work by pushing air backwards really fast
claims.explanation: Simplified but essentially correct - Newton's third law

claims.claim: Airplane wings generate lift using the Bernoulli principle alone
claims.explanation: Lift involves both Bernoulli and Newton's laws, not just one

claims.claim: The A320 was the first commercial fly-by-wire airliner
claims.explanation: A320 introduced digital fly-by-wire to commercial aviation

claims.claim: You're more likely to be struck by lightning than die in a plane crash
claims.explanation: Statistical comparison is accurate for commercial aviation

claims.claim: Aircraft can land safely with total engine failure
claims.explanation: Aircraft can glide; famous examples include Gimli Glider

claims.claim: The X-15 reached speeds of Mach 6.7
claims.explanation: X-15 rocket plane achieved Mach 6.72 in 1967

claims.claim: Commercial jets can do barrel rolls safely
claims.explanation: Possible but not recommended; Boeing 707 famously did one

claims.claim: The first jet airliner was the de Havilland Comet
claims.explanation: Comet entered service in 1952, first commercial jet

claims.claim: Howard Hughes flew around the world in under 4 days in 1938
claims.explanation: Set record of 3 days, 19 hours, 17 minutes

claims.claim: Hypersonic passenger flights will cut travel time by 90%
claims.explanation: While theoretically possible, 90% reduction is exaggerated
